intro: Engelhardia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine ironwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in lowland and montane rainforests, reaching heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a glossy dark green surface. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers followed by woody capsules containing seeds.
